sentences: COP President Hedegaard recalled the practice since COP 1 of applying the draft rules of procedure ( FCCC/CP/1996/2 ), with the exception of draft rule 42 on voting.
Papua New Guinea opposed, stating that agreement by consensus based on the lowest common denominator is gravely negligent given the seriousness of climate-change impacts.
He supported taking decisions by a majority of two-thirds of parties present and voting.
COP President Hedegaard said she would consult on the issue.

On Friday, 18 December, COP Vice-President Mohammad Barkindo (Nigeria) reported that the COP President had consulted on the issue, noting parties maintained their fundamental positions and there was no consensus.
He therefore proposed that the COP continue to apply the draft rules of procedure with the exception of draft rule 42.
